org.apache.ambari.server.controller

Class ActionExecutionContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.ambari.server.controller.ActionExecutionContext

  • public class ActionExecutionContext
extends Object
    The context required to create tasks and stages for a custom action

      static interface  ActionExecutionContext.ExecutionCommandVisitor
      Interface that allows a final attempt to setting values on an ExecutionCommand

      • isRetryAllowed

        public boolean isRetryAllowed()
        Gets whether the action can be retried if it failed. The default is true).
        Returns:
        true if the action can be retried if it fails.

      • setRetryAllowed

        public void setRetryAllowed(boolean allowRetry)
        Sets whether the action can be retried if it fails.
        Parameters:
        allowRetry - true if the action can be retried if it fails.

      • isFailureAutoSkipped

        public boolean isFailureAutoSkipped()
        Gets whether skippable actions that failed are automatically skipped.
        Returns:
        the autoSkipFailures

      • setAutoSkipFailures

        public void setAutoSkipFailures(boolean autoSkipFailures)
        Sets whether skippable action that failed are automatically skipped.
        Parameters:
        autoSkipFailures - true to automatically skip failures which are marked as skippable.

      • getStackId

        public StackId getStackId()
        Gets the stack to use for generating stack-associated values for a command. In some cases the cluster's stack is not the correct one to use, such as when distributing a repository.
        Returns:
        the stack to use when generating stack-specific content for the command.

      • setStackId

        public void setStackId(StackId stackId)
        Sets the stack to use for generating stack-associated values for a command. In some cases the cluster's stack is not the correct one to use, such as when distributing a repository.
        Parameters:
        stackId - the stackId to use for stack-based properties on the command.

      • addVisitor

        Adds a command visitor that will be invoked after a command is created. Provides access to the command.
        Parameters:
        visitor - the visitor

      • isMaintenanceModeHostExcluded

        public boolean isMaintenanceModeHostExcluded()
        Gets whether hosts in maintenance mode should be excluded from the command.
        Returns:
        true to exclude any hosts in maintenance mode from the command, false to include hosts which are in maintenance mode.

      • setMaintenanceModeHostExcluded

        public void setMaintenanceModeHostExcluded(boolean excluded)
        Sets whether hosts in maintenance mode should be excluded from the command.
        Parameters:
        excluded - true to exclude any hosts in maintenance mode from the command, false to include hosts which are in maintenance mode.

      • visitAll

        public void visitAll(ExecutionCommand command)
        Called as a way to post-process the command after it has been created and various objects have been set.
        Parameters:
        command - the command

      • isFutureCommand

        public boolean isFutureCommand()
        Gets whether Ambari should skip all kinds of command verifications while scheduling since this command runs in the future and might not be considered "valid".

        A use case for this would be during an upgrade where trying to schedule commands for a component which has yet to be added to the cluster (since it's added as part of the upgrade).

        Returns:
        true if the command is scheduled to run in the future.

      • setIsFutureCommand

        public void setIsFutureCommand(boolean isFutureCommand)
        Sets whether Ambari should skip all kinds of command verifications while scheduling since this command runs in the future and might not be considered "valid".

        A use case for this would be during an upgrade where trying to schedule commands for a component which has yet to be added to the cluster (since it's added as part of the upgrade).

        Parameters:
        isFutureCommand - true to have Ambari skip verification of things like component hosts while scheduling commands.
